name: plank
title: Plank
primer: is a simple bodyweight exercise that involves holding a push-up position, keeping the body straight from head to heels. It primarily targets the core muscles, promoting strength and stability.
steps: Begin by lying face down with your elbows bent directly under your shoulders and your forearms on the ground.
Lift your body off the ground, keeping your body in a straight line from head to heels, and hold this position for the desired duration, engaging your core muscles.

name: V-Up
title: V-Up
primer: A dynamic core exercise where you lie on your back, simultaneously lifting your legs and upper body to form a V-shape, targeting abdominal muscles.
steps: Lie flat on your back with arms extended overhead and legs straight.
In one fluid motion, lift your legs and torso off the ground, reaching your hands toward your feet, then lower back down with control.

name: Wall push Up
title: Wall push Up
primer: A beginner-friendly upper body exercise where you stand facing a wall and perform a push-up motion by pressing against the wall, engaging chest and arm muscles.
steps: Stand about arm's length away from a wall, with feet shoulder-width apart and hands flat against the wall at shoulder height.
Lean forward and bend elbows to lower your chest towards the wall, then push back to starting position, keeping your body in a straight line.

name: T-plank
title: T-plank
primer: A challenging core exercise where you hold a plank position, then lift one arm straight up toward the ceiling, forming a T-shape with your body, engaging core and shoulder muscles.
steps: Start in a plank position, with forearms on the ground and body in a straight line.
Lift one arm up towards the ceiling, rotating your torso while keeping hips square, then return to plank position and repeat on the other side.

name: Push_Up
title: Push Up
primer: A classic bodyweight exercise targeting the chest, shoulders, and triceps, performed by lowering and raising the body while maintaining a straight line from head to heels.
steps: Start in a plank position with hands shoulder-width apart and feet together.
Lower your body until your chest nearly touches the ground, then push back up to starting position.
references: Lower your body until your chest nearly touches the ground, then push back up to starting position.

name: Pike Push Up
title: Pike Push Up
primer: A variation of the push-up targeting the shoulders and upper body, performed by starting in a downward dog position and bending the elbows to lower the head towards the ground.
steps: Begin in a downward dog position with hands on the ground and hips raised high.
Lower your head towards the ground by bending your elbows, then push back up to the starting position.

name: Squat
title: Squat
primer: A fundamental lower body exercise involving bending the knees and lowering the hips, engaging muscles of the thighs, glutes, and core.
steps: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, toes slightly turned out, and chest lifted.
Lower hips back and down as if sitting into a chair, keeping knees aligned with toes, then return to standing position.

name: Wall-sit squat
title: Wall-sit squat
primer: A static lower body exercise where you hold a seated position against a wall, engaging muscles of the thighs and glutes.
steps: Lean against a wall with feet shoulder-width apart and knees bent at a 90-degree angle, creating a seated position.
Hold this position for a desired duration, keeping back against the wall and thighs parallel to the ground.

name: Arm-Circle
title: Arm-Circle
primer: A dynamic shoulder exercise involving circular movements with extended arms, targeting shoulder mobility and flexibility.
steps: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and arms extended straight out to the sides.
Rotate arms in small or large circles, forward or backward, maintaining control and engaging shoulder muscles.

name: Dip Chair
title: Dip Chair
primer: A strength-building exercise using parallel bars, engaging the triceps and chest muscles by lowering and lifting the body.
steps: Grip parallel bars with palms facing inward and elbows slightly bent, keeping feet off the ground.
Lower body by bending elbows until upper arms are parallel to the ground, then push back up to starting position.
